paper.title: The information center concept: a normative model and a study of six installations
paper.publisher: Society for Information Management and The Management Information Systems Research Center
paper.abstract: The principal current concern of corporate information centers is the support and management of end-user computing. This paper presents a normative model of an information center in terms of the end-user computing environment, discusses the results of extensive field interviews with information center managers, staff, and end-users, and draws conclusions and generalizations that are relevant for both future research and information center management.
